posts.post_content:
[Stronghold Àssàssin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=25645) is the preferable Zombie Àssàssin most of the time:  
The latter is a 2/1 for ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) which requires tapping itself and saccing a creature for the effect, while  
this one is a 3/2 for ![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) which needs to exile itself in particular instead and in addition also two cards in your graveyard.
posts.html:
Stronghold Àssàssin is the preferable Zombie Àssàssin most of the time:
The latter is a 2/1 for which requires tapping itself and saccing a creature for the effect, while
this one is a 3/2 for which needs to exile itself in particular instead and in addition also two cards in your graveyard.

Posted By: blindthrall (3/19/2011 12:01:53 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card absolutely reeks of being zealously over balanced. I would not be surprised to find out this card originally had an activation something along the lines of "tap and sacrifice Zombie Assassin, destroy target creature" and cost a colorless less. But then the balancing hammer came around and hammered him so bad that the card is completely unplayable.   
  
The entire casting cost of Zombie Assassin along with activation is now 4 colorless and a black, remove a creature in play and two creatures in your graveyard from the game to simply destroy a NONBLACK creature. That does not even follow flavor...do the zombies turn to dust? Does it take 3 zombies to take out 1 nonblack creature? Why can't they destroy black creatures?   
  
Bad card.
posts.html:

The entire casting cost of Zombie Assassin along with activation is now 4 colorless and a black, remove a creature in play and two creatures in your graveyard from the game to simply destroy a NONBLACK creature. That does not even follow flavor...do the zombies turn to dust? Does it take 3 zombies to take out 1 nonblack creature? Why can't they destroy black creatures?

Bad card.
